dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: The Caspian Sea's shallowing is a direct consequence of climate change, not just river regulation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The Caspian Sea's shallowing is a direct consequence of climate change, not just river regulation.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Caspian Sea's shallowing is a consequence of climate change and is not linked to the regulation of water flow in the Volga River.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, Dmitry Kirillov from Rosvodresursy really emphasized that point in his interview.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, Dmitry Kirillov from Rosvodresursy really emphasized that point in his interview.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Addressing the issue will require joint efforts from all five countries bordering the sea, said Dmitry Kirillov, head of Rosvodresursy, in an interview with RIA Novosti.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, he said it's tempting to blame the Volga River, but that's not the full picture at all.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, he said it's tempting to blame the Volga River, but that's not the full picture at all.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Of course, the easiest explanation for the Caspian Sea's shallowing is to blame the Volga and reservoir regulation. But that's not entirely true"or not true at all.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly—there are so many factors, like precipitation changes and rising temperatures leading to more evaporation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly-there are so many factors, like precipitation changes and rising temperatures leading to more evaporation.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: There are many factors involved, including precipitation, climate change, temperature increases, and, as a result, greater evaporation from the sea's surface, said the Russian water resources expert.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And that increased evaporation is a huge part of the problem, which makes it way more complex than just managing one river.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And that increased evaporation is a huge part of the problem, which makes it way more complex than just managing one river.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which is why he stressed that all five countries around the Caspian need to work together on this.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is why he stressed that all five countries around the Caspian need to work together on this.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He emphasized that solving the Caspian Sea's shrinking issue demands cooperation among all coastal states.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely—Azerbaijan, Iran, Turkmenistan, Kazakhstan, and Russia all have a stake here.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely-Azerbaijan, Iran, Turkmenistan, Kazakhstan, and Russia all have a stake here.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Caspian Sea borders Azerbaijan, Iran, Turkmenistan, Kazakhstan, and Russia.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And it's not just about the Volga; there are like 30 rivers flowing into the sea from those nations.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it's not just about the Volga; there are like thirty rivers flowing into the sea from those nations.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kirillov added that sustainable water regulation should not be limited to the Volga, as around 30 rivers flow into the Caspian Sea from five different countries.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So the measures have to be multifaceted—coastal protection, fighting desertification, sustainable water management…
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So the measures have to be multifaceted-coastal protection, fighting desertification, sustainable water management...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Adaptation measures must be multifaceted. They concern coastal areas, desertification, and of course, sustainable water resource management, he noted.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's a massive coordination challenge, honestly. No single country can tackle this alone.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's a massive coordination challenge, honestly. No single country can tackle this alone.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And with climate change accelerating, the urgency is just growing year by year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And with climate change accelerating, the urgency is just growing year by year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Do you think there's enough political will among those nations to actually collaborate, though?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Do you think there's enough political will among those nations to actually collaborate, though?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: That's the million-dollar question. Kirillov seems hopeful, but it's gonna require serious commitment.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's the million-dollar question. Kirillov seems hopeful, but it's gonna require serious commitment.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. Adaptation on this scale isn't optional—it's essential for the region's future.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. Adaptation on this scale isn't optional-it's essential for the region's future.
